author: news24.com
title: Future of News24 without comments
text:
When I first started to comment on News24 in the beginning of 2014,News24 was a very comment orientated news site.News articles were short,wafer thin, basically just a SAPA feed.The same story would even be repeated over and over.The headlines were meant to elecit comments.That is how I saw it,that is how many people saw it.The more comments,the more advertising revenue.The election of 2014 saw a flood of EFF articles,because News24 knew that would draw a lot of comments.
I found the articles without depth,without the story behind the story.I tried my best to fill in the gaps.I did it because I knew that our country's future depend on people being informed,to make informed decisions.
I saw a slight improvement since News24 broke away from SAPA,since they appointed their own journalists.But do News24 realise that the reason they got many hits was that people came to the site because they knew that they could comment and read other people's comments?
People wont be coming to the site for comments now.So what will attract them now?
News24 say they want to be in the same league as CNN, Reuters and Popular Science. That will take some doing.
If the articles of News24 in future are not fair,with depth and with background and facts,in other words quality journalism,i predict the end of News24
